title: Implement Secrets Detection Pre-commit Hook
description: Add pre-commit hooks to prevent accidental secret commits, integrating gitleaks with ACGS-2's secrets_manager.py patterns for comprehensive protection

phases.description: Analyze current secret detection setup and prepare configuration

subtasks.title: Analyze existing gitleaks configuration
subtasks.description: Review .gitleaksignore and GitHub workflow to understand current gitleaks usage patterns
subtasks.notes: Completed comprehensive analysis. Key findings: Gitleaks in CI only (not pre-commit), minimal .gitleaksignore with 1 exception (SAML cert), need custom ACGS-2 patterns, placeholder detection required. Created gitleaks-analysis.md with detailed findings.
acceptance_criteria: Documented list of currently ignored secrets
Understanding of gitleaks configuration in CI
List of file patterns that need secret scanning

subtasks.title: Review secrets_manager.py patterns
subtasks.description: Extract CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS and SECRET_CATEGORIES to inform hook configuration
subtasks.notes: Completed comprehensive analysis. Extracted 8 CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS with regex details, identified 7 additional secrets without patterns, documented 5 placeholder categories (dev-*, your-*, <...>, empty, redacted), created detection logic, and mapped to gitleaks rules. Created secrets-patterns-analysis.md with complete findings including valid/invalid format examples and file-specific handling rules.
acceptance_criteria: List of all credential patterns from secrets_manager.py
Understanding of what constitutes a valid vs invalid secret format
Identification of placeholder vs real secrets

subtasks.title: Design hook strategy
subtasks.description: Design multi-layered approach: gitleaks for general scanning, custom hook for ACGS-2 specific patterns
subtasks.notes: Completed comprehensive hook strategy design. Created detailed strategy document covering multi-layered approach (gitleaks + custom ACGS-2 hook), file scanning/exclusion strategy, performance optimizations (<5s target), three-tier allow-list system, context-aware validation, phased rollout plan, and success metrics. Key decision: Single source of truth using CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS from secrets_manager.py. Document: hook-strategy.md
acceptance_criteria: Documented hook strategy with rationale
List of files/patterns to scan vs exclude
Performance considerations documented

phases.description: Add gitleaks as a pre-commit hook for industry-standard secret detection

subtasks.title: Add gitleaks to pre-commit config
subtasks.description: Configure gitleaks as a pre-commit hook in .pre-commit-config.yaml
subtasks.notes: Successfully added gitleaks v8.21.2 to .pre-commit-config.yaml. Hook configured with --staged flag for efficient scanning of only staged files, --redact for security, and --verbose for debugging. Automatically uses existing .gitleaksignore. Verified hook runs successfully in pre-commit workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Gitleaks hook added to .pre-commit-config.yaml
Hook configured to use existing .gitleaksignore
Hook runs efficiently (doesn't scan entire history)

subtasks.title: Create gitleaks configuration file
subtasks.description: Create .gitleaks.toml with ACGS-2 specific rules and allow-lists
subtasks.notes: Successfully created .gitleaks.toml with comprehensive ACGS-2 configuration. Includes: 8 custom rules for AI provider keys (Anthropic, Claude Code, OpenRouter, HuggingFace, OpenAI), enhanced rules for AWS/JWT/Vault tokens, global allowlist for dev placeholders (dev-*, test-*, your-*, etc.), path exclusions for .env.example/tests/docs, and integration notes for secrets_manager.py. Configuration validated by pre-commit hook - passes successfully. Commit: 1042f9f39
acceptance_criteria: .gitleaks.toml created with custom rules
Configuration allows placeholder secrets (e.g., 'dev-jwt-secret-min-32-chars-required')
Configuration catches real credential patterns from secrets_manager.py

subtasks.title: Update .gitleaksignore with known safe secrets
subtasks.description: Add fingerprints for development/test secrets that are safe to commit
subtasks.notes: Successfully updated .gitleaksignore with comprehensive fingerprints and documentation for safe development/test secrets. Added: (1) sp.crt certificate alongside existing sp.key entry, (2) Three .env.dev development secrets with detailed justifications (JWT_SECRET, REDIS_PASSWORD, POSTGRES_ML_PASSWORD), (3) Comprehensive documentation including what each secret is, why it's safe, and production mitigation. Each exception clearly documents that these are development-only placeholders with real secrets managed via Vault/secrets manager in production. Added best practices notes and guidelines for future additions. Commit: 01a011541. Pre-commit hooks verified - gitleaks passes successfully.
acceptance_criteria: .gitleaksignore updated with documented exceptions
Each exception has a comment explaining why it's safe
Test certificates and placeholder values properly ignored

phases.description: Create custom pre-commit hook using CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS from secrets_manager.py

subtasks.title: Create custom secrets detection script
subtasks.description: Build scripts/check-secrets-pre-commit.py using patterns from secrets_manager.py
subtasks.notes: Successfully created scripts/check-secrets-pre-commit.py. Script imports CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS directly from secrets_manager.py, validates against 8 patterns, distinguishes placeholders using 5-category detection (dev-*, test-*, your-*, etc.), provides actionable error messages with remediation steps, scans only staged files for performance, and exits with code 0 (pass) or 1 (fail). Includes file exclusions (.env.example, test fixtures), binary file skipping, and category-based risk reporting. All pre-commit hooks pass (ruff, bandit, gitleaks). Commit: a72fec167
acceptance_criteria: Script validates credentials against CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS
Script distinguishes between placeholder and real secrets
Script provides clear error messages with remediation steps
Script exits with appropriate codes (0=pass, 1=fail)

subtasks.title: Add allow-list for development secrets
subtasks.description: Create configuration for known-safe development secrets and placeholders
subtasks.notes: Successfully created comprehensive .secrets-allowlist.yaml configuration file with three-tier allow-list system (pattern/path/value-based). Includes documented safe values from .env.dev and .env.example, placeholder patterns (dev-*, test-*, your-*, etc.), file exclusions, binary/media extensions, feature flags, and performance settings. Updated scripts/check-secrets-pre-commit.py to load configuration with PyYAML, falling back to defaults if unavailable. Created .secrets-allowlist.README.md with complete documentation, usage examples, best practices, and troubleshooting guide. All pre-commit hooks pass (ruff, bandit, gitleaks). Commit: 7a3781d97
acceptance_criteria: Allow-list configuration file created
Placeholder patterns documented (e.g., 'dev-*', 'test-*')
Allow-list includes .env.example and .env.dev safe values

subtasks.title: Integrate custom hook into pre-commit
subtasks.description: Add custom hook to .pre-commit-config.yaml as local hook
subtasks.notes: Successfully integrated ACGS-2 custom secrets detection hook into .pre-commit-config.yaml. Hook configuration: ID=acgs2-secrets-detection, entry point=scripts/check-secrets-pre-commit.py, file types=.py/.env/.yaml/.yml/.json (regex: \.(py|env|ya?ml|json)$), excludes test fixtures/examples/templates via comprehensive regex pattern. Hook tested and passed during commit. Complements gitleaks with ACGS-2-specific CREDENTIAL_PATTERNS from secrets_manager.py. Integration verified - hook runs automatically on commits and shows 'ACGS-2 Secrets Detection...Passed' in pre-commit output. Commit: 085f033d6
acceptance_criteria: Custom hook added to pre-commit config
Hook runs on relevant file types (.py, .env, .yaml, .json)
Hook excludes test fixtures and example files appropriately

All tests passing with realistic secret patterns
